title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss the Patriots' season opener against the Raiders due to a lingering hamstring injury.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is questionable for Sunday's game with an ankle injury, coach Mike Vrabel announced.
The Raiders, with new head coach Pete Carroll and QB Geno Smith, will challenge a reshuffled Patriots secondary.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum is making progress in recovery from a ruptured Achilles, with improved mobility, according to teammate Jordan Walsh.
Celtics have no timeline for Tatum's return, prioritizing his full recovery before he plays again.
Celtics' offseason roster changes provide opportunities for young players as Tatum continues his rehabilitation.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Raiders are starting a new era with Pete Carroll as head coach and Geno Smith as quarterback.
Tom Brady will miss Sunday's game due to Fox Sports obligations, despite being a minority owner of the Raiders.
Maxx Crosby and rookie Ashton Jeanty are key players for the Raiders, facing a Patriots team with a shaky run defense.

title: What does it mean that TreVeyon Henderson is listed 3rd on the Patriots’ depth chart?
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: TreVeyon Henderson is listed as RB3 on the Patriots' depth chart behind Rhamondre Stevenson and Antonio Gibson.
Henderson impressed in preseason with a 100-yard kick return and an eight-yard rushing touchdown against the Vikings.
Patriots likely to continue using a running back committee; Stevenson, Henderson, and Gibson expected to share reps.

title: Here’s what fantasy football experts are saying about Patriots players in Week 1
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Drake Maye is seen as a fantasy sleeper against the Raiders, given their middling pass defense and lack of interceptions.
Rhamondre Stevenson is expected to lead the Patriots in carries for Week 1, despite rookie hype around TreVeyon Henderson.
Stefon Diggs is ready to play without restrictions against the Raiders, potentially boosting the Patriots' offensive performance.

title: Hundred-year book debate: Which 1926 classic still stands the test of time?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The Hundred-Year Book Debate at the Boston Public Library focuses on books from 1926.
Notable 1926 books include Hemingway's 'The Sun Also Rises' and Milne's 'Winnie-the-Pooh'.
Readers can vote on their favorite 1926 book by September 27, with a live debate in February 2026.

title: As Fernandes Anderson’s sentencing looms, read what Boston city councilors wrote in letters to judge
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Former Boston City Councilor Tania Fernandes Anderson awaits sentencing on federal wire fraud and theft charges.
Councilor Brian Worrell highlighted Anderson's guilty plea, suggesting her readiness to learn and continue community contributions.
Councilor Liz Breadon requested at-home confinement, emphasizing Anderson's commitment to serving vulnerable populations.

title: Two-thirds of BPS school buses were on time on day 1. Here’s how that compares to last year.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Boston Public Schools achieved a 66% on-time bus arrival rate on the first day of school in 2025.
The 2025 rate marks an improvement from last year's 34% first-day on-time performance amid a new app rollout.
BPS aims to improve further, targeting the 95% monthly on-time rate required to avoid state takeover.

title: Look inside Back Bay’s Sheraton Boston after a $100 million renovation
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Sheraton Boston in Back Bay completes a $100 million renovation for its 60th anniversary, enhancing guest rooms and common areas.
Renovation features include residential-inspired rooms, a redesigned lobby with Community Tables, and a state-of-the-art 24-hour fitness studio.
The upgraded hotel offers 70,000 square feet of event space, five ballrooms, and a panoramic pool deck with a retractable roof.

title: Insider predicts how Alex Bregman, Trevor Story will handle player options with Red Sox this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Bregman likely to opt out of his Red Sox contract; could attract interest from Yankees, Phillies, Tigers.
Trevor Story expected to opt in to his Red Sox contract, remaining for two more years through 2027.
Red Sox prepare for potential infield changes; Marcelo Mayer is a candidate to replace Bregman if he leaves.
